comment.author: 63358774@N02
comment._content:
Well, actually, this place is Picayune Strand Forest State Park and what you see is the remaining of a big scam ocurred in the '60s. Is a state preserve, protected, not open to development. What you see are streets not canals, it was supposed to be a city but obviously, it is located in the middle of the swamps so, it is dry during the winter season and totally flooded during the summer. 

Also, it is true that the canals are not a natural feature. Indeed, prevents the natural flow of water from central Florida to the Gulf of Mexico.
